contentheadline.headline: Grammy Award for Best Classical Performance, Operatic or Choral

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=June 2009}} The [[Grammy Award]] for '''Best Classical Performance - Operatic or Choral''' was awarded in 1959. The equivalent award, '''Best Classical Performance - Opera Cast or Choral''' was awarded in 1960. Since 1962 the award has been divided into separate awards for opera and choral performances. See [[Grammy Award for Best Opera Recording]] and [[Grammy Award for Best Choral Performance]]. Years reflect the year in which the Grammy Awards were presented, for works released in the previous year. == 1960s == *[[Grammy Awards of 1960]] **[[Erich Leinsdorf]] (conductor), [[Lisa Della Casa]], [[Rosalind Elias]], [[George London (baritone)|George London]], [[Roberta Peters]], [[Giorgio Tozzi]] & the [[Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra]] for ''[[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart|Mozart]]: [[The Marriage of Figaro]]'' == 1950s == *[[Grammy Awards of 1959]] **[[Roger Wagner]] (choir director) & the [[Roger Wagner Chorale]] for ''Virtuoso'' [[Category:Grammy Awards for classical music]] [[Category:Opera recordings|*]]
